title: 10. IRRI Agronomy Challenge: Are Insects a Problem? (2 & 6 February 2012)

tasks.task: Assessing rice field insect activity and natural pest control.
subtasks: Identify whirled maggots and determine their significance.
Recognize parasitoid wasp cocoons and their role in controlling pests.
Observe lady beetles and their predatory behavior against herbivores.
Note dragonfly presence and their impact on mosquito larvae.
Identify midges as decomposers and beneficial to the ecosystem.
Evaluate the difference between beneficial insects and perceived pests.

tasks.task: Monitoring for rodent damage in the rice field.
subtasks: Notice signs of rat activity, such as chewed seedlings.
Assess the potential for rat damage and limitations in mitigation.
